title: (x) Wallpaper\* - Amplitude, Big Caslon, Typ 1451, Le Corbusier, Burin Sans, and Plantin Schoolbook {Stephen}
content:
Hi. I’m sure someone has already asked about this, but the search function is not working for me.

I need to know the typefaces used in Wallpaper\* mag for a university project I have. The inital assumption was that it is Meta of some variety, but I’ve noticed the lowercase gs in Wallpaper have a closed loop but in Meta they are open.

I am stuck, WhatTheFont was no help either. Any help would be appreciated! If anyone knows the serif face used as well, that would be awesome.

Thanks

Nicole
author: Ikiimi

comments.content:
Haven’t seen it in a few months, but they have used [Amplitude](http://web.archive.org/web/20090419081213/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&searchstr=amplitude), [Big Caslon](http://web.archive.org/web/20090419081213/http:/www.typophile.com/node/1874), Typ 1451, Le Corbusier, Burin Sans, and Plantin Schoolbook.

And here’s some analysis of a 2003 issue of [Wallpaper typography](http://web.archive.org/web/20090419081213/http:/typographi.com/000490.php).

FYI - Google will limit a search to any site. Type:

[`site:typophile.com wallpaper`](http://web.archive.org/web/20090419081213/http:/www.google.com/search?hl=en&lr=&q=site%3Atypophile.com+wallpaper&btnG=Search)

Err I am a spaz. I tried Google earlier by just typing typophile.com:wallpaper.

Anyway, thank you! You are my new hero.

You are my new hero.

Join the club. :^)
